goal: Scale to the ninth in quarter notes

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 0
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 1
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter-Note One Bar Rhythm Pattern 2
exerciseSequence.description: Play both notes evenly and in time.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter-Note One Bar Rhythm Pattern 3
exerciseSequence.description: Play the notes evenly and precisely.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter-Note Rhythm Pattern 4
exerciseSequence.description: Quick, precise finger movement.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter-Note Rhythm Pattern 5
exerciseSequence.description: Play all notes with the same tone.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Pattern 6
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note with a strong sound for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter-Note Interval Pattern 7
exerciseSequence.description: Quick and precise finger movement.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 8
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note with a strong sound for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Five Note Scale Pattern 9
exerciseSequence.description: Play all notes evenly. Look ahead to the next note.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 10
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note with a strong sound for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Five Note Scale Pattern 11
exerciseSequence.description: Play all notes evenly. Look ahead to the next note.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Arpeggio Pattern 12
exerciseSequence.description: This is an arpeggio. Notice how it skips notes..

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 13
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note with a strong sound for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Five Note Scale Pattern Pattern 14
exerciseSequence.description: Play each note evenly. Repeat as many times as you can!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Five Note Scale Pattern Pattern 15
exerciseSequence.description: Play strictly in time with the metronome.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 16
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note with a strong sound for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Scale Pattern Pattern 17
exerciseSequence.description: Play strictly in time with the metronome.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Scale Pattern Pattern 18
exerciseSequence.description:
Hold the note for the full value. 
Use a comfortable dynamic. 
Strive for a consistent, clear, in-tune, sound.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Whole Note Long Tone Fermata Pattern 19
exerciseSequence.description: Hold the note with a strong sound for as long as you can. Make sure it has a clean ending!

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Ninth Scale Pattern Pattern 20
exerciseSequence.description: Adding the ninth helps the scale fit the metre.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Arpeggio Pattern 21
exerciseSequence.description: This is an arpeggio. Notice how it skips notes..

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Ninth Scale Pattern Pattern 22
exerciseSequence.description: Quick finger movement for a clean sound.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Arpeggio Pattern 23
exerciseSequence.description: Repeat as many times as possible before the last note.

exerciseSequence.title: G Major Quarter Note Arpeggio Pattern 24
exerciseSequence.description: Repeat as many times as possible before the last note.
